moves.2... d6: Still normal, though Nc6 is more common.
moves.3... h5: ? This is where black starts to go wrong - I prefer Nf6, attacking the undefended e-pawn. Perhaps he was thinking about attacking down the kingside.
moves.4... Qd7: ?! Again, I prefer Nf6 or Nc6 or even Bg5 - this odd queen move blocks in the bishop and leaves a chance of a pin on the diagonal.
moves.5. Nd5: ! I give this move an exclamation since it ties the queen down to defending c7.
moves.5... Qa4: ?? Oh dear - this leaves c7 vulnerable and wins a rook - but it also wins the queen. Not 6. Nxc7!? which looks obvious but ...
moves.6. Bb5+: The perfect fork - watch out for this in your games, it comes across a lot.
moves.6... Qxb5: Black has no choice, but to take.
moves.7. Nxc7+: And Nxc7! - winning a pawn and queen for the bishop - a lovely tactic: I came across this in 'Chess Tactics for kids' and it is rather good. And a rather good family fork.
moves.8. Nxb5: And the knight chomps away the queen.
moves.8... a6: No surprise, but I think black should be thinking about developing here.
moves.9... h4: Again, a pointless move - why not play Nf6?
moves.10... h3: I think black is seriously into attacking the kingside.
moves.11. g3: gxh3 is okay, but it opens the line for the rook, so I just played g3.
moves.12. dxe5: I take the pawn, and the pawn can't take back since it is pinned.
moves.12... Ke6: I think the king is just waiting to be attacked.
moves.13. Qd5+: This bold queen move makes the king retreat.
moves.13... Kd7 14. exd6: Note if Bxd6 then e5! wins the bishop.
moves.15... Ke8: The king retreats - probably the safest move.
moves.16... Ra7: This leaves the knight undefended - I could have gobbled it up, but I was more focused on a mate.
moves.17... Nd7: I think this move was just to save the knight, but this annoyingly prevents mate, since the king as d8 as a flight square -
moves.18... Ndf6: An outright blunder - first of all, the pawn could take it, and, though I am not criticising my opponent, this falls for Nc7#. Which I gladly played.
moves.19. Nc7#: Nc7# - thank you for watching - please give any constructive comments if necessary. @oodle3#
